intro: Helicteres paniculata, commonly known as the panicled helicteres, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters in height, characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, three-lobed fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Helicteres paniculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous cultures.
